In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you could implement the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width && !isempty(result)
            println(result)
            result = ""
        elseif isempty(result)
            result *= word
        else
            result *= " $(word)"
        end 
    end
    return result
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
input_text = "This is a sample text. This text needs to be wrapped."
println(wrap_string(input_text, 15))
```
In this example, each new line starts with the same string as the previous line (i.e., "This is a sample" and then "text. This text"). The function also checks if `result` is empty to avoid starting a new line without any content.
